overview: This subject examines learning in and through the arts, including music, drama, dance, and the visual arts, with a focus on aesthetics, symbolic communication and creative pedagogies. Students will investigate how children make meaning through creative inquiry as part of sustainable communities. Students will design, implement and evaluate arts experiences for young children, informed by practical and theoretical studies. Students will develop an informed knowledge of arts-based and culturally sustaining pedagogies that include Indigenous Worldviews and concepts of Country.
ilo: Evaluate and contextualise the poetics and aesthetics of early childhood settings and local place and Country
Conceptualise and apply how arts-based creative and cultural pedagogies involve multiple ways of being and doing, promoting creativity, technological experimentation, and acting in sustainable ways

Apply the languages of the arts to build rich, interdisciplinary experiences in early childhood settings that examines the materiality of the socio-cultural-environmental and aesthetic needs of children and their communities
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base
